articles.title: While You Were Asleep: Luka Modric hints at retirement, Scaloni defends his team’s behaviour, Pepe says he played with broken arm
articles.description: I want to retire in Madrid, says Luka Modric. Lionel Scaloni defends his Argentina players who goaded Dutch opponents. We didn't deserve to leave the way we did, says Pepe.
articles.content:
Luka Modric ahead of the much-awaited semi-final clash between Croatia and Argentina has said that retiring at Real Madrid would be a dream.

articles.title: GRAINS-Wheat at 1-week high on Ukrainian export woes, soybeans firm
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Dec 13 (Reuters) - Chicago wheat futures rose for a second straight session on Tuesday, fuelled by concerns over exports from the Black Sea region after a weekend attack temporarily shut down a key Ukrainian port, disrupting grain shipments.Soybeans edged up after closing lower on Monday, although rains in Argentina and forecasts of wet weather in Brazil limited the

articles.title: Lionel Messi and Argentina face tough test against Croatia before shot at World Cup glory
articles.description: Lionel Messi is just two matches away from World Cup glory but his Argentina side must first find a way past Croatia at the Lusail Stadium on Tuesday.
articles.content:
CNN —
Lionel Messi is just two matches away from World Cup glory but his Argentina side must first find a way past Croatia at the Lusail Stadium on Tuesday.

articles.title: Luka Modric hints at retirement plan ahead of World Cup 2022 semi-final
articles.description: Real Madrid midfielder Luka Modric has fielded questions about his future on the eve of Croatia's World Cup semi-final against Argentina - and he's hinted he is keen to stay put
articles.content:
Luka Modric has admitted that retiring at Real Madrid would be a "dream" in the biggest hint yet that he is keen to extend his stay in the Spanish capital beyond this season.
Modric, 37, is currently with thriving in Qatar with Croatia at the World C... [2457 chars]

articles.title: Can Argentina and France beat Croatia and Morocco?
articles.description: The heavyweights can’t take these upstarts for granted.
articles.content:
The best part about the 2022 World Cup semifinals is that every potential outcome from this point on is a good one.
